      Unix

      Unix is an Operating System invented by Ken Thompson and Dennis Ritchie at AT&T's Bell Labs in 1970. It remains the inspiration for the Linux Operating System.

      External Links

      • Prezi: History of Linux
      • "BSD Unix: Power to the people, from the code," Salon
      • "Understanding the bin, sbin, usr/bin, usr/sbin Split," Hacker Monthly
      • Basics of the Unix Philosophy, Eric Raymond, catb.org
      • Keynote from BSDCan 2015: Stephen Bourne, "Early Days of Unix and Design of sh" - YouTube
